intro: Gongronema bracteolatum, commonly known as the African nettle, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes other stinging plants. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small greenish-white flowers in clusters. Its stems are covered in fine hairs and can cause a skin irritation when touched. Gongronema bracteolatum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks.
